servinfo.title: DTC P0102: Mass Air Flow Circuit Low Input

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0101: Mass Air Flow Circuit Range / Performance .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: DTC will be set when all of following conditions are detected for 0.5 seconds continuously.

item.ptxt: Voltage of MAF sensor output is less than specified value for specified time continuously.
Open or short in MAF sensor circuit

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Start engine and run it for 10 sec.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: MAF sensor and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.

testgroup.question: Is normal value indicated?

paragroup.ptxt: Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: MAF sensor power supply voltage check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from MAF and IAT sensor with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between engine ground and “BLU/BLK” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 10 – 14 V?

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch, measure resistance between “BLU” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and engine ground.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Measure resistance between “C37-27” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

action.ptxt: “BLU” wire is open or high resistance circuit.

paragroup.ptxt: ECM grounds “C37-58”, “C37-48”, “C37-30”, “C37-29” and/or “C37-15” circuit is open or high resistance.
If wires are OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “RED” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: “RED” wire is shorted to other circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “RED” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned OFF.

action.ptxt: “RED” wire is shorted to ground circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “RED” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and “C37-26” terminal of ECM connector.

action.ptxt: “RED” wire is open or high resistance circuit.

testgroup.title: MAF sensor output signal check

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to MAF and IAT sensor and ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “C37-26” and “C37-27” terminals of ECM connector referring to Mass Air Flow (MAF) and Intake Air Temperature (IAT) Sensor On-Vehicle Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is each value within specified range?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
